item.title: Katrina add a quote by Rumi
item.description: "Sit, be still, and listen, because you're drunk and we're at the edge of the roof." -- Rumi

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Marjane Satrapi
item.description:
"The regime had understood that one person leaving her house while asking herself: Are my trousers long enough?' Is my veil in place?' Can my make-up be seen?' Are they going to whip me?'
No longer asks herself:
Where is my freedom of thought?' Where is my freedom of speech?' My life, is it livable?' What's going on in the political prisons?" -- Marjane Satrapi

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Michael Muhammad Knight
item.description: "The earth isn’t spinning because you told it to do so. Your intestines aren’t digesting by your command. You’re made up of a trillion cells who don’t ask your permission before offering their rakats. And we think submission is applying strict discipline to our worship? We think surrender is about not eating a pig? It’s just not that small to me. i can’t fit my deen into a neat little box, because to me everything comes from Allah. Birds sing Allah’s name. to say Allah is in this book and not that… do you know who you’re talking about? the Allah that made you from a clot and clothed in flesh… Allah is too big and open for my deen to be small and closed." -- Michael Muhammad Knight

item.title: Katrina add a quote by Ryunosuke Akutagawa
item.description: "A man sometimes devotes his life to a desire which he is not sure will ever be fulfilled. Those who laugh at this folly are, after all, no more than mere spectators of life." -- Ryunosuke Akutagawa
